block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's auction of three- and six-month bills and a 52-week bill auction today. In observance of Memorial Day, there was no trading yesterday in Treasury securities and futures on the Chicago Board of Trade.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.64 percent, and the six-month bill was 6.06 percent. The rate for the 52-week bill was 5.86 percent.

The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's auction of three- and six-month bills and a 52-week bill auction today. In observance of Memorial Day, there was no trading yesterday in Treasury securities and futures on the Chicago Board of Trade.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.64 percent, and the six-month bill was 6.06 percent. The rate for the 52-week bill was 5.86 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
DaimlerChrysler, $1.5 billion in a two-parts global E-bond offering, A1/A+/---, Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Westvaco, $400 million in a two-part note offering, A3/A-/---. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
(Source: MCM CorporateWatch Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's/Duff & Phelps Credit.)
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Community Development Administration Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, $138.2 million of debt securities. Legg Mason Wood Walker.
Alameda County, Calif., Transit, $50 million of debt securities. M. R. Beal & Co.
Cuyahoga County, Ohio, Hospital Facilities, $90 million of revenue bonds. Cain Brothers.
Fayette County, Ga., Public Facilities Authority, $55.9 million of revenue bonds. The Robinson-Humphrey Co.
Hawaii Housing, $100 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
New York City Water Authority, $330 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Sacramento, Calif., Sanitation District, $401 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Missouri Water Pollution Control Environmental Improvement and Energy Resources Authority, $73.3 million of revenue notes for clean water program.
Tennessee Housing Development Authority, $100 million of debt securities. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
